intro: Mentha × eliae, commonly known as the peppermint-lemon mint hybrid, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Mentha piperita (peppermint) and Mentha citri (lemon mint). It is characterized by its aromatic, menthol-rich leaves that emit a strong, cooling scent. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with square stems and opposite, serrated leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mentha × eliae is widely cultivated for its use in herbal teas, aromatherapy, and as a flavoring agent in various food and cosmetic products.
